TITLESTMT.TITLE: King Horn; a Middle-English romance, edited from the manuscripts by Joseph Hall.

AVAILABILITY.P: Where applicable, subject to copyright. Other restrictions on distribution may apply. Please go to http://www.umdl.umich.edu/ for more information.

TITLESTMT.TITLE: King Horn; a Middle-English romance, edited from the manuscripts by Joseph Hall.
TITLESTMT.AUTHOR: Hall, Joseph, ed. 1854-

NOTESSTMT.NOTE: Introduction.--Grammar.--Metre.--The story.--King Horn in three parallel texts.--Notes.--Horn Childe.--Glossary.--Index of manes.

PROJECTDESC.P: Header created with script mrcb2teiutf.xsl on 2006-02-22.

EDITORIALDECL.P: This electronic text file was created by Optical Character Recognition (OCR). No corrections have been made to the OCR-ed text and no editing has been done to the content of the original document. Encoding has been done using the recommendations for Level 1 of the TEI in Libraries Guidelines. Digital page images are linked to the text file.

TITLEPAGE.BYLINE:
EDITED FROM THE MANUSCRIPTS
BY
JOSEPH HALL, M.A. HEAD MASTER OF THE HULME GRAMMAR SCHOOL, MANCHESTER

EPIGRAPH.Q1: 'Ne al soh ne al les þat leod-scopes singeð.'

DOCIMPRINT.PUBLISHER: PRINTED AT THE CLARENDON PRESS BY HORACE HART, M.A. PRINTER TO THE UNIVERSITY

DIV1.HEAD: MS. Harleian, 2253. British Museum, London.
Title in a later hand?Her bygynneþ þe geste of Kyng Horn

LG.L: a song ychulle ou singeou singe over an erasure MS.
feyrore child ne myhte be born
for reyn ne myhte by ryne
so whit so eny lylye flour
so rose red wes his colour
þat on wes hoten Athulf chyld
Hyt was vpon a someres day
þer he was woned to ryde
wiþ him ne ryde bote tuo
al to fewe hue were þo
þy lond folk we wolleþ slon
þe kyng lyhte of his stede
mid y wis huem wes ful wo
þat habbe myhte hue na more
þer hue seruede godeafter hue r erased MS.
ant euer hue bad for horn child
mid is feren of þe lond
payenes him wolde slopayenes] payenos MS.
of wordes he wes swyþe bold
ȝef þou to lyue mote go
þat ȝe shule slen vs alle
þare fore þou shalt to streme go
þou ant þy feren al so
ne shal hit vs of þenche
þe children ede to þe stronde
ah neuer wors þen him wes þo
ant þat ship wel suyþe drof
al þe day & al þe nyht
o þat sprong þe day lyht
vr ship is come to ryue
hure ship bi gon to ryde
ant say þat he shal fonde
crist him myhte blessecrist] est MS.
þat bueþ her a londe ycomen
he wes þe wysesteþe corrected out of þy MS.
vre ship flet forþ ylomeship] p over an erasure MS.
& her to londe hit ys ycome
Nou þou myht vs slen & bynde
ah ȝef hit is þi wille
help vs þat we ne spille
sey child whet is þy name
wel brouc þou þy nome ȝyng
þe kyng com in to halle
ant tech him alle þe listes
tech him of harpe & of song
for he wes in hire þohte
hue louede him in hire mod
for he wes feir & eke god
& þah hue ne dorste at bordhue] h corrected out of some other letter MS.
mid him speke ner a word
wiþ horn þat wes so feir & fre
þo hue ne myhte wiþ him be
In herte hue hade care & wo
þat he come hire toover an erasure MS.
& also shulde horn doover an erasure MS.
& þe sonde saydesayde over an erasure MS.
¶ þe stiward wes in huerte wo
for he nuste whet he shulde do
he toke wiþ him an oþer
þou shalt wiþ me to boure gon
þou art hornes ylicheyliche] y corr. out of i.
þat hue wole horn mys rede
Hue seten adoun stilleWritten over an erasure, except wille.
ant seyden hure willeWritten over an erasure, except wille.
ne tel þou no more speche
for horn nis nout her ynne
ne worþest þou me neuer lef
Ne speke y nout wiþ horne
ant list were fore ych wonde
con lyþe wiþ hyre mouþehyre] hy corrected out of ly MS.
haue ich of him mi wille
to speke wiþ rymenild þe ȝynge
wel þou sitte & sostesofte] soþte MS.
rymenild kinges dohterRymenild] y corrected out of e MS.
& sore bigon to sykento syken struck out before bigon.
Þo rymenild þe ȝyngeȝynge and l. 448, except nynge, written over an erasure.
to þe kynges fet in halle
hou he hede yfareyfare] f over erasure MS.
Ich þe rede mid al my myht
god knyht he shal þe ȝelde
al þat þe lyhte day sprong
& bed him buen a god knyht
& of vs þat by him stonde
þin armes he haueþ & þy sheld
nou do þat þi wille ys
& made hem alle to knyhteknyhte] k over an erasure MS.
to þi wyf þou me take
er ne he eny wyf take
to day so crist me blesse
hit is ful god to þi dobbyng
ffor mi loue þou hit were
& on þy fynger þou hit bere
ne shalt þou in none place
& sound aȝeyn þe bryngeþe] þere MS.
þe knyht hire gan to cusse
þer he toc his gode fole
he seh a shyp at grounde
ant on is arm hit wype
þe saraȝyn he hitte sosaraȝyn] saraȝy followed by hole in MS. and mark of contraction.
þat is hed fel to ys to
ant þohte o rymenyld þe ȝynge
he sloh þer of þe beste
kyng quoþ he wel þou sitte
to day ich rod omy pleyyng.
y smot hem alle to grounde
¶ Horn ne þohte nout him on
hue seide ich nout ne wepe
a gret fyssh ate þe ferste
ne do þat þe mis lyke
þat fyssh þat brac þy net
þat wol vs do sum teneteọne MS.
ant so he doþ wel ofte
go out quoþ aylmer þe kyng
her nast þou nout to doneAfter nout ḍ MS.
wiþ armes he gon him shrede
so he shulde in to place
ne stod he nout to longe
to is suerd he gon teon
ne durste non wel him seon
þe fyssh þat þyn net rende
þe kyng wiþ me gynneþ striue
a wey he wole me dryue
nou y mot founde & fare away
ȝyf y ne come ne sende
ant forþ he con hym ryde
a god ship he him herde
fot out of ship hy setten
ant what ys nome weres in ys over an erasure MS.
ant toc him bi þe bridel
kyng wiþ him þou ast done
for he is þe feyreste man
þat euer in þis londe cam
¶ þo seide þe kyng wel dere
ant when þou farest to wowen
þer þou hast munt to wyue
a wey he shal þe dryue
nouþer more no lasseno might be read ne MS.
ȝef oure þre sleh ure onure] oure MS. All this line and the first four words of 822 written over an erasure.
we shulen of ore londe gon
ȝef vre on sleh oure þre
al þis lond shal vre be
to morewe shal be þe fyhtynge
ah wat shal vs to rede
ant com him to þe kynge
kyng quoþ he com to felde
ys feren gonnen hem wiþ drawe
for huere maister wes neh slawe
y ne heuede ner of monnes hond
so harde duntes in non lond
þat drof him out of londe
ant þohte o rymenild þe ȝynge
mid god suerd at þe furste
he smot him þourh þe huerte
þe payns bigonne to fleonfleon] l corrected out of e MS.
þo wes Godmod swyþe woGodmod] G corrected out of h MS. wo over an erasure.
ant þe payens he smot so
þe paiens hy felle to grounde
lette leggen is sones on bere
in a chirche of lym & ston
me buriede hem wiþ ryche won
ant seide godmod ȝef þou nere
nys non so feyr of blod ant bone
Ermenild þat feyre mayOn the inner margin MS.
bryht so eny someres dayOn the inner margin MS.
ant her kyng shalt þou be
he seyde more ichul þe serue
heo ne shal me noþyng werne
to rymynyld sonde ne sende he non
ant wolde hyre han to wyue
þat horn ne louede nout lyte
wher so er me myhteWher] Whe MS.
til o day þat he ferde
Horn seide leue fereAfter Horn two letters erased MS.
ne mihte ich him neuer cleche
ne may ich of him here
þe see him con ded þrowesee omit. MS.
¶ Horn com to þurston þe kynge
rymenild help me to wynnehelp over an erasure MS.
for hue shal to spouse haue
he is knyht mid þe beste
¶ Horn dude him in þe weye
þe wynd bi gon to blowe
þe see bi gan wiþ ship to gon
ne mihte he come no latere
ant com him vp to londe
so he sprong of þe stone
ant he seide on is tale
þat hue ne wep wiþ eȝe
þah he were out of londe
quoþ horn so crist me rede
þat summe hit shal of þynke
ant gan to wrynge is lippe
he made foule cherechere] chē MS.
horn bed vn do wel softe
he þrew him a doun þe brugge
ant sette him doun wel lowe
ase hue were out of wytte
þat trewe wes in vch plawe
¶ aþulf wes o tour ful heh
Rymenild ros of benchebenche] b over an erasure MS.
an horn hue ber an honde
for þat wes lawe of londe
þou shenh vs wiþ þe vurste
hyre horn hue leyde a doune
ant fulde him of þe broune
hue wende he were a glotoun
ant drync þis ber al vppe
ne seh y neuer y wene
þou wenest ich be a beggere
Min net lyht her wel hende
wiþ inne a wel feyr pende
nou is þis þe seueþe ȝere
ȝef eny fyssh hit tokeAfter fyssh an erasure of two words, probably y toke, MS.
ȝef eny fyssh is þer inne
drynke nully of dysshnke null over an erasure MS.
drynke to horn of hornedrynke, dronke both with contraction for es MS.
wel fer ich haue y orne
ne kneu hue noht is fysshyng
why for horn he bed drynke
hue fulde þe horn of wyne
ant dronke to þat pelrynedrynke, dronke both with contraction for es MS.
ant þreu is ryng to grounde
what y þreu in þe drench
þe ryng þat þou yn þrewe
þou sey wer þou hit nome
for so me þo bitiddeAfter so þ struck out MS.
þe ship nom in to flode
Horn by gan be sek & deȝe
to slein mide hire kyng loþe
horn in is armes hire kepteAfter armes erasure of one word MS.
his shurte lappe he gan take
& wypede a wey þe foule blake
ne am ich horn þyn owe
Aþulf gon forth springeforth] froth MS.
ant dude him in þe weye
þe gle þat þer was fonge
kyng wes mi fader of kenne
þou dryue me out of þi lond
Ne shal ich hit ner agynne
þe ship by gan to croude
huere ship by gon to ryde
a croyȝ of ihesu cristes lawe
þe knyht him lay on slape
þou sei me whet þou kepest
my suerd shal þe to hewe
for horn þat is of age
þat he ne comeþ to fyhte
to don hem alle of lyue
wiþ hem wes aþulf þe gode
ȝef horn is hol ant sounde
ȝef y myhte se hem tueye
¶ knyht be þenne blyþeAfter knyht an erasure of about two letters MS.
Þe knyht to horn gan skippe
þo hue to gedere y come were
ȝungemen hou habbe ȝe ȝore yfare
o lyue ȝef hue þe wiste
ant so we shulen hem teche
¶ Horn gon is horn bloweis] s corr. out of d MS.
þe olde & eke þe ȝongeBefore þe olde de MS.
ant in to þe castel fette
þat þer yn come ne myhte
bote when þe see wiþ drowe
Rymenild forte shendeOver an erasure MS.
to wyue he gan hire ȝerne
þe kyng ne durst him werne
þat in to shipe wes take
of his lemmon he wes adred
ant fykenild her þe day springe
þe see bigon to wiþ drawe
þo seh horn his felawehorn] horns MS.
þat þer set in þat tyde
ant toc him to felawetoc] tot MS.
þat he euer hede of weste
þo nes þer non þat lowe
þe gode stiward of hire fader hous
kyng Mody wes kyng in þat lond
þat horn sloh wiþ is hond
þe wynd him con wel dryue
þer horn wo couþe er fonde
Rymenild he made þer is quene
In trewe loue hue lyueden ay
ant wel hue loueden godes lay
crist to heouene vs lede AmeN.

DIV1.HEAD: MS. Laud, Misc. 108. Bodleian Library, Oxford.

LG.L: A song ich wille you singe
Here sone hauede to name horn
Feyrer child ne micte ben born
Ne reyn ne micte upon reyne
So rose red was hys colur
He was fayr and eke bold
Þat on was hoten ayol child
Hit was in one someres day
Þat morye þe gode kingemorye] moye MS.
Þer he was woned to ryde
He fond bi þe strondestronde] r above line MS.
Þi lond folc we wilen slon
And al þat god leuet on
And þe we solen sone anon
Þe king licte adoun of his stede
But ywis hem was ful wo
Sone micten alle þeþe] þ with an erasure of one letter MS.
And nomen hyt al to honde
For mory he wep soremory] moy MS.
In to a roche of stone
And euere bed for horn child
Þat ihesu crist him were mild
Mid his feren of þe londe
Of wordes he was swiþe baud
Þou art fayr and eke strong
In þis fif yere þe nexte
Ȝif þu to liue Mictest go
Þe for þou scald to stron go
An sinken to þe grundeAn] A MS.
Ne sal hit us of þinke
For yf þou come to liue
Ofte hauede horn child be wo
Horn yede in to þe shipes bordHorn] Horns MS.
Þat ware him lef and dere
Al þe day and al þe nict
Til him sprong þe day lyt
And so þe gras him springespringe] sc̣pinge MS.
Þanne spek þe child hornchild] chid MS.
Quen godild my modergodild] c̣godild MS.
And sei þat he shal fonge
For he spek to horn child
Þat here to londe ben ycome
Horn spak for hem alleHorn] Hor MS.
And of swiþe godeswiþe] swiịþe MS.
Paynims þer were riueriue] riueḍ MS.
Wit uten seyl and roþerroþer] r above the line MS.
And he to londe it wan
And yf it be þi wille
Help us þat we ne spilleHelp] Helps MS.
Sey me child wat is þi name
Ne schal þe tide bote game
Sone so he hit herdehe om. MS.
Horn hich am hoteHorn] Hor MS.
Horn child qwad þe kingHorn] Hon MS.
Þe king com in to halle
Þe heye stiward of his hous
Tech him of harpe and songe
And aylbrous gan lerenBefore leren ḥịṃ MS.
Wit hinne þe curt and wit oute
For folc þer was so mecheFor] For for MS.
In herte hye haue kare and wo
Þus he hire bi þoucte þo
And be he schold hire comen toAfter be, erasure of one or two letters, perhaps bed.
Þe stiward was in herte wo
He ne wiste wat he micte do
Þou shalt wit me to boure gon
Wel sore y me of drede
Þat hye wile horn mis redehye] y corr. out of o.
Ich habbe y loued þe stronge
And ich þe louerd to helde
Ne tel þou more spechetel] te MS.
Sum man þe wile bi keche
Þi tale bi gyn to lynne
For horn nis nouth her inne
To bringe þe horn to honde
He wende forþ to horneHẹ ẉẹṇḍẹ fọṛþ MS.
He schal mid me bi leue
Had ich of hym my wille
Ne reche y wat men telle
After mete stilleAfter stille ẉịṭ MS.
Horn be me wel treweHor MS.
Ne schal it þe nouth rewe
Ne þar him no ma teche
Þe kinges stiward and houreknges MS
And tok him by þe swere
So fayr so god þe makede
For þe ich habbe sorwehabbe] halbe MS.
And plyct þou me þi trewþe
And ȝyue þe ioye and bliffeþe] þ MS. Before bliffe ḅịḷḷ MS.
Ich am hy bore to lowe
Bituene a þral and þe king
And sore forto sykeAnd] d above line.
Þin herte gyn þou to stere
And help þou me to knictehelþ] heþ MS.
And þenne hy schal wite more
Þou art so fayr and briycte
Nym þou here þis coppeNym] y corr. out of e.
Þat he dubbe þe to knicte
Horn god lene þe wel spede
And tok him þat he browte
He talede to him þereþere] the first e corr. out of o MS.
He telde him of his nede
To halle he ȝede wel swiþe
Ich þe wolde rede ate lest
God knict he schal ben helde
To be knict him by seme
Þe day by gan to springe
Horn cam bi forn þe kinge
Wit swerde horn he girdegirde] d corr. out of t MS.In the margin opposite ore est horn adobbe.
Rit honder hys herteIn the margin opposite ore est horn adobbe.
And bed him ben god knict
Graunte me my beneBefore my ḅ MS.
Þat in sodenne was hy born
Of vs þat bi him stonde
Þo seyde þe king wel sone wis
Do horn as hys wil hys
Horn to boure wendeHorn] Hor MS.
He nam his felawe in hys honde
And fonde Reymyld in boure stonde
And ayol chil þe bi forn
Yf þou be trewe of dedes
To wif þou schalt me take
Hy schal don al þi wille
Hat first hyt mote by tyde
Þer fore ne haue ich þe forsake
To day so god me blisseblisse] bịlisse MS.
Yich wene ich may þe leue
Haue nou here þis gold ringþis] s above line MS.
He his god to þi dobbing
Ne hys non swilk vnder sonne
Hy graue hys on þe Ringe
Þe ston him hys of swiche grace
Þat þou ne schal in none place
He sal haue a noþerBefore sal ịṣ MS.
Horn god hy þe bi techeBefore teche ṭạḳẹ MS.
Þe knict hyre gan to kusse
He tok forþ his gode fole
Þat al þe court gan denye
Hys fole gan forþ springesc̣þinge MS.
And horn merie to syngeAfter horn ị MS.
Mid water alby flowesarazine] sararine MS.
A geant him gan by holde
And slen al þat þer ben hinne
And on his arm hyt wipe
Þat al hys blod was hot
He lokede on hys gode ringe
And þoute on reymild þe yenge
Of þat þer were aryueþer] þe MS.
He seyde king wel mote þou sitte
Þer y rod on my pleying
Of none londische menneOf] Off MS.
My swerd me ne wolde fayle
Þe day bi gan to springe
And horn wente in to boure
Hye seyde ich nawt ne wepe
Bote ich schal her ich slepe
To se my net ich keste
Þe fys me so by laucteBefore fys f̣ịṣ MS.
Þe fys þat ich wolde chese
Ne do þat þe mis like
Ich nime þe to my nowe
Reymyld weþ wel stilleweþ omit. MS.
Þe fis þat brac þi seyne
Hy wis hyt was som bleine
Þat schal us do som tene
Hy wis hyt worþ hy sene
Þe king rod bi his toure
And horn was in þe boure
An seyde hise folyeIn the margin hic accusatur horn.
And so he hys wel ofte
Do him out of þi londe
Her he do more schondehe omit. MS.
Wit swerd hy wole þe hette
Here hauest þou nowt to done
With armes he hym gan schrede
So he scholde in to place
Þo hyt þer to gan ten
Ne durst him noman senhim] hīṛẹ MS.
Ne stod he nowt to longe
Þe fys þi net to rente
Þe king gynneþ wiht me striue
Bot ȝyf hy come oþer sende
A god schip he him herde
To londe he gan fletteflette] f above the line, l corrected out of s MS.
And out of schip him sette
And tok hym by þe bridel
Wel be þou knict here founde
Ne sey ich neuere on lyue
And grette wel þe gode king
Whit hym þou hauez to doneþou omit. MS. hauez] z above line MS.
Tak hym þi lond to werye
Þat euere in þis londe cam
Þo seyde þe king so dere
An mak him glad and blyþe
Þer þou hauest Mynt to wyue
Þe king hym makede a feste
Armed of paynimearmed might be read ariued.
One þer of wille ich fyȝte
Ȝyf þat houre felle þyne þre
Al þis lond schal vre be
Al þys lond þanne be ȝyure
To morwe schal be þe fyȝtyng
Cubert he schal be þat on
At wat schal do to rede
Ich wene we ben alle dede
Syre king hyt nis no ryȝcteAfter Syre kyre MS. nis omit. MS.
Hys brenye on he castehe] ke MS.
He cam bi forn þe gode kingHe] Ke MS.
He seyde king com to felde
Hys feren gonnen hem wyt drawe
He seyden knyct þo resteAfter reste þ̣ẹ MS.
Of man so harde dunteAfter man ṇẹṣ ḥọṇḍẹ MS.
By for hym he sey stonde
Þat drof hym out of londe
He lokede on hys gode ringeAfter hys c̣ọ MS.
And þoute on reymyld þe ȝonge
He smot hym to þe herte
And seyde kyng so þou haue reste
Clep nou forþ ofe þi beste
An strokes hye þere kautestrokes] r above the line MS.
He schedde of here blodeAfter here ḅọ MS.
Þer nas Bute fewe slaweAfter nas ṇọṇ ḥỵ MS. Bute] te above line MS.
Þe king bi gan to grete
Þe king cam hom to halle
At more ich wile þe serue
Kyng ȝyf þou me my renteȝyf] ȝys MS.
Ne schalt þou hire me werne
Þe seuenþe þat cam þe nexte
After þe sexteAfter sexte ỵẹṛes ḥẹṇḍẹ MS.
Þat wolde hyre habbe to wyue
Þat horn ne louede nawt lite
For horn hym was so longe
Tyl on a day þat he ferde
Qwat þe page y wole þe telle
Þat for hym ney waxeþ wild
So wel þe grom by tide
And sey þat he ne morne
Ich schal ben þer by tyime
Þe se hym gan to drenche
Þe se hym gan op þrowe
Of boure þat he was ynne
Horn cam to þurston þe kinge
Þat þou ith nowt ne lynne
He hys knyt wyt þe beste
Þo seyde þe kyng so stille
To hym were come hy nowe
And dude him in hys weyehī in added in the margin MS.
Here scyp gan forþ seyleforþ] r inserted under line MS.
Þe soneday was hy sprongespronge] sp with erasure of two letters following MS.
And ȝede hym op to londe
So he were spronge of stone
Þe palmere seyde on hys tale
Þey he nere nawt in londe
Palmere qwad horn so god me rede
Ich and þou willen chaungen wede
To day ich schal þere drynke
Som man hyt schal of þinke
Þe sclavyn he gan doun legge
And horn hyt dide on rigge
Þat ne weren hym nowt loþe
For to come þer inneþer] r above the line MS.
Horn gan to þe yate turne
He pugde hym ofer þe brigge
And horn gan in to halle rake
Al so hy were of witte
Þat trewe was and ful of lawe
An horn hye ber on honde
As hyt was lawe of londe
And horn set on þe grunde
Þe horn hye leyde a doune
And fulde hem of þe broune
Hye wende hye were a glotounwere corr. out of iaere MS.
Horn tok þe coppe hys fere
Þou wenst ich be a beggere
For gode ich am a fyȝssere
Hyc am hy come to loke
Ich am hy come to fyȝsse
Drink to me of þy disse
Horn drank of horn a stounde
and þrew hys ryng to þe groundehys] s above line MS. þe] e above line MS.
A ryng hy grauen of golde
Ich aue hy go mani amyle
Þat fond ich horn child stonde
Þat scyp hym ȝede to flode
Myd me and horn þe gode
And for his loue me bed
To schipe with me þe ring
Horn ne worþ me na more
Hye fel adoun on þe bed
In þat hulke nyȝtenyȝte omit. MS.
Knyf to hyre herte hye sette
Hys schirt lappe he gan take
Ne am ich al þyn owe
In þyn armes þou me kusse
To day we schole hem keche
Ryȝt nou ich wolle hem teche
Of tok he horn hy wys
Here lyue he gonnen þer leten
Þat here non hym by wreyde
And ofte he fworen hoþef holde
Of horn þat was fo hendehorn] hor MS.
Horn ledde hyre hom wit heyfe
Þe joye þat þer was fonge
And bed he fcholden alle here
Kyng waf My fader of kunne
Þo me to knyȝte þou ȝoue
My knyȝt hede ich haue proued
To þe of me men feyde
Ich ne fchal neuere a gynne
Er ich fodenne wynneThe guard on f. 226 v has her ich fodẹne wyne.
Þat lond ich schal of reche
Ich schal be kyng of tunebe] ke MS.
And wite of kynges owneBefore owne erasure of one letter, apparently t or s MS.
Horn gan to schipe rydeHorn] Hor MS.
Þe wynd hym bleu wel loude
Here schip bigan to glideschiþ] s above line MS.
A crowch of ihesu cristes lawe
Þe knyt hy lay on slepe
In armes wel y meteSubstituted for Ḥoṛṇ ḥỵṃ g̣ạ̄ ṃ MS.
Me þynkeþ by þe crowches lysteþe] þ corr. out of c MS.
Wyt Mi swerd ich schal þe hewe
Þe gode knyt op a rosknyt] n above line MS.
And þo were come in to þif yle
Bi god on wam y leue
For horn þat hys of age
And wyt hym men an hundred
Þat he ne comeþ fiȝyctene omit. MS.
Þer mong was ayol þe gode
Myn owe child myn owe fode
Ȝyf horn hys hol and sounde
Bote ich nou se hem tweye
Þe knyt to hem gan steppe
Þe Joie þat he madeJoie] i above line MS.
He seyde wit steuene ȝarewit above line MS.
Children hou abbe ȝe fareabbe] albe MS.
Wyt Myn hyrysce menneBefore menne ṇẹ MS.
Þis lond we schollen winneBefore we ṃ MS.
And sle al þat þere ben inne
And so we scholen hem teche
Horn gan hys horn blowehorn above line MS.
Þat hys folc it gan knowe
He comen out of scyp sterne
Þe nyȝt and eke þe ouȝten
Þe held and eke þe ȝonge
Wit inne eueriche walleRepeated with wyt instead of wit MS.
To wiue he gan hire ȝerne
Þe kyng ne dorst him wernehim] hīṛẹ MS.
And lym þer to he madelym] hym MS.
Miȝt no man hon on legge
Bote wan þe se wit drowese omit. MS.
Þer Miȝte come ynoweþer Mūche come MS.
Þis fykenild gan to wendewende] wēḍde MS.
Reynyld for to wendefor over an erasure, for in margin MS.
Þe day by gan to wexe
Fekenyld her þe day gan springe
He ledde hyre hom in derke
Þat in to schype was take
Þat schip scholde on hire blenche
And his knyȝtes by sideknyȝtes] ȝ corrected out of c MS.
Þe song by gan to drye
Wel be þou here to londe come
Þer may no man on legge
Of Reymyld þat þou ne misse
He askede wat hye wereaskede] arkede MS.
Þo was þer non þat lowe
Hey lokede on hys gode Ryng
Dude hym alle truagetruage] utrage MS.
Horn tok rymyld by þe hond
And ledde hire by þe se strond
Þer he hadde woned so longe
A sang ihc schal ȝou singe
He hadde a sone þat het horn,
Fairer ne miste non beo born.
Fairer nis non þane he was,
He was briȝt so þe glas,
He was whit so þe flur,
Þat he alle wiþ him ladde;he omit. MS.
Þat on him het haþulf child,
Hit was vpon a someres day,
ariued on his londehis] s above line MS.
And alle þat Crist luueþ vpon
Þe kyng aliȝte of his stede,
Al to fewe he hadde þo.
Þe king hadde al to fewe
Þat no payn hit ne wiste:
Eure heo bad for horn child
Þat Jesu crist him beo myld.
Wiþ his feren of þe londe.
Ȝef þu mote to liue go
Ne schal hit us noȝt ofþinche;
Þe children hi broȝte to stronde
At neure wurs þan him was þo.
Þe se þat schup so fasste drof
Al þe day & al þe niȝt,
¶ Til Horn saȝ on þe stronde
Gret þu wel of myne kenne,
Þat ihc am hol & fererasure of one letter, apparently k, before am MS.
And seie þat hei schal fonde
He him spac to horn child
Þat her to londe beoþ icume,
Ne sauȝ ihc in none stunde
Nu þu miȝt vs slen & binde,
Bute ȝef hit beo þi wille,
'Seie me, child, what is þi name,
Þanne hym spak þe gode kyng,
¶ Þe kyng com in to halle
Þat was stiward of his hus:
Þu tech him of alle þe liste
Þat neȝ heo gan wexe wild:
For heo ne miȝte at borde
Ne nowhar in non oþere stede:
Þe stuard was in herte wo,
For he nuste what to do;
Þu schalt wiþ me to bure gon,
& in to bure wiþ him ȝede.
He wende þat horn hit were
For horn nis noȝt her inne.
Ihc nolde him ne þe bigile.'
Ne wurstu me neure more leof;
Ne spek ihc noȝt wiþ horn
Horn is fairer þane beo he:Hor MS.
Wiþ muchel schame mote þu deie.'
To hauen of him mi wille,
After ne recchecche what me telle.'me might be read ine.
Horn in halle fond he þo
Ne schal hit þe neure rewe.'
Of wyn to drinke his fulle:
Þu schalt haue me to þi wif;
& fundling bifalle.fundling] d above line MS.
Ne feolle hit þe of cunde
¶ Horn in herte was ful wo,
& tok hire on his armes two:
He gan hire for to kesse
Bifore me þis niȝte.'þis] s above the line MS.
Til þe liȝt of day sprang
He sette him on a stede whit:
Þer nas no kniȝt hym ilik.
He smot him a litel wiȝt
& bed him beon a god kniȝt.
Biuore þe king Aylmar.Biuore] re above the line MS.
Nu is kniȝt sire hornkniȝt] kniȝ MS.
Þat in suddenne was iboren:was] s above the line MS.
Ouer us þat bi him stonde:
To fiȝte wiþ vpon þe feld:
& makede hem alle kniȝtes.hē alle above the line MS.
And sede, 'welcome, sire horn,welcome] wescome MS.
Do nu þat þu er of spake,
Ef þu art trewe of dedes,
Vn bind me of my pine.'
Ihc wulle don al þi wille.
Ar ihc þe ginne to woȝe.
For þi me stondeþ þe more rape.
For þi luue in þe felde
Ihc schal þe take to wyue.'
Ihc wene ihc mai þe leue:
Þer nis non betere anonder sunne
Þat eni man of telle cunne;
For my luue þu hit were
& on þi finger þu him bere:
Þe stones beoþ of suche grace
Þat þu ne schalt in none place
Þar he tok his gode fole
Þat al þe curt gan denie,
Þat folc þat he gan quelle:
He verde hom in to halle
King, þat þu me kniȝti woldest.'
A Moreȝe þo þe day gan springe
þe king him rod an huntinge;
Þat was þe wurste moder child.
To þe se my net icaste,
A gret fiss at þe furste
Ihc wene þat ihc schal leose
Þe fiss þat ihc wolde cheose.'
Oþer sum Man schal vs schende.
Þe fiss þat brak þe lyne
& wurþ wel sone isene.'sone above the line MS.
And þider þu go al riȝt,
Þu do him vt of londe,
He fond horn in arme.fond] r erased between o and n MS.
So he scholde in to place;
Þe fiss þat þi net rente,
He custe him wel a stundeAfter wel an erasure of longe? MS.
Horn tok his leue,Horn] n above line MS.
ne miȝte he no leng bileue;bileue] leue above line MS.
Kynges sones tweie:Kynges] s above the line MS.
Ne saȝ i neure my lyue
Cutberd heo ladde in to halle,
'Sire king, of him þu hast to done,
Bitak him þi lond to werie,
Ne schal hit noman derie;schal] schat MS.
For he is þe faireste man
Þat eureȝut on þi londe cam.'
¶ Þanne sede þe king so dere:
And whan þu farst to woȝe,farst] t above the line MS.
Ne schal þe neure wel spede.'
Ȝef vre on ouercomeþ ȝour þreo,
Al þis lond schal vre beo.
Whane þe liȝt of daye springe.'
Bute what schal vs to rede?
Ihc wene we beþ alle dede.'
& sede þes wordes:þes] s above line MS.
On wiþ þre to fiȝte,þre] þe MS.
Horn his brunie gan on caste,
'King,' he sede, 'cum to feldefelde] fel MS.
Þe kniȝtes felle iswoȝe.iswoȝe] e above line MS.
To him his swerd he droȝ,
He smot him þureȝ þe herte,
Þat sore him gan to smerte;
Þe paens þat er were so sturne,
Gunne after hem wel swiþe hiȝe,
To deþe he hem alle broȝte,
His fader deþ wel dere hi boȝte:
Ne scapede þer no wiȝte,þer] þer er MS.
& burden hem ful ȝare.&] ȝ MS.
¶ Þe king com in to halle
Among his kniȝtes alle.kniȝtes] s above the line MS.
& þu art kniȝt of muchel pris,
Þi doȝter þat ȝe me bede,
Ower rengne for to lede.for above the line MS.
Wel more ihc schal þe serue,
Sire king, ȝef me mi rente:
Ne schaltu me hire werne.'wụrne with e written above ụ MS.
Þat to Rymenild he ne sente
Þat wolde hire haue to wyue:
Aton he was wiþ þe king
Þat horn ne luuede noȝt lite.
Horn noȝt þer of ne herde,
Til o dai þat he ferde
Þat for him gan wexe wild.
& bringe to his bedde,his] s above the line MS.
On of hornes enemis.hornes enemis] s, s both above the line MS.
Þe knaue was wel bliþebliþe] e above the line MS.
& hiȝede aȝen bliue.aȝen above line MS.
Of þe hus þer heo was in,
If heo oȝt of horn isiȝe.of above line MS.
Þo fond heo þe knaue adrent
Þat he hadde for horn isent,
¶ Horn cam to þurston þe kyng.þurston] r above line MS.
Þat þu noȝt ne linne:ne above line MS.
Horn dude him in þe weie
Þe wind him gan to blowewind omit. MS.
Ne miȝte he come no latere.
Horn him ȝede alone,Horn] Hor MS.
Þat heo ne weop wiþ iȝe:
Þeȝ he were vt of londe.
To bure þat me hire ladde.
His sclauyn he dude dun legge,
He makede him a ful chere
Horn gan to þe ȝate turne
Horn þreu him ouer þe brigge,
Þat his ribbes him to brake,
Ine may no leng hure kepe,
Alle dronken of þe ber.dronken] o above line MS.
Him þuȝte he was ibunde.he above line MS.
Þu ȝef vs wiþ þe furste,
For heo wende he were a glotoun.
Ne saȝ ihc neure, so ihc wene,
Wyn nelle ihc Muche ne lite
Mi net liþ her bi honde,
Ihc am icome to fisse:icome above line MS.
Ne kneu heo noȝt his fissing,
Whi he bad to horn drinke.
Heo fulde hire horn wiþ wyn
Horn dronk of horn a stunde
Þo fond heo what heo wolde,
Þat horn isterue were,isterue] isteue MS.
Þu seie whar þu hit nome,
Þe schip nam to þe flode
Wiþ me & horn þe gode;After Wiþ an erasure of two letters MS.

Þat þe haþ pined þe so sore.'

He wipede þat blake of his swere
¶ 'Rymenhild,' he sede, 'ywendeErasure of ȝe before ywende MS.
And to horn þu go wel swiþe.

He dude hem alle to kare.
Of ffikenhildes falfe tunge.ffikenhildes] es above line MS.
To þe kinges palais.kinges] s above line MS.
Þat gle þat þer was funge.
Ine feie hit for no blame,
Aþulf wiþ him his brother,hī above line MS.
A kniȝt hende in felde.kniȝt] t above line MS.
Þat þu longest to vre driȝte.

He sede: 'ihc haue aȝenes my wille

Þo icom to þis illeicom] com above line MS.
On him hi makede ¶ me reue,
Fram horn þat is of age,

Horn hi vt of londe sente;

Min oȝene child, my leue fode:
Ef horn child is hol & sund,
Mest of alle siþe;of above line MS.
Þat ihc ȝou seȝ hit is ful ȝare.
'Iblessed beo þe time,beo above line MS.

To speken vre speche.vre above line MS.
Horn gan his horn to blowe,

ne lefde þer non in þende.
He com to his Moder halle
Bute whanne þe se wiþ droȝe
To woȝe he gan hure ȝerne,
Þe kyng ne dorste him werne.
ffikenhild or þe dai gan springe
Al riȝt he ferde to þe kinge,
He ladde hure bi þe derke
Þat þer was in þat tide
Wel beo þu to londe icome:
Noman wiþ · none · ginne.none above line MS.
Of Rymenhild þat þu ne misse.'
He sette him on þe benche
His harpe for to clenche.clenche above line MS.
Ne was þer non þat louȝe.
Hit smot to hornes herteto above line in darker ink MS.
& þoȝte on Rymenhilde.on in darker ink over an erasure MS.
Wiþ gode suerdes orde.suerdes] s above line MS.
Fikenhild hi dude todraȝe.dude above line MS.
¶ Horn tok Rymenhild bi þe honde
Þe gode stuard of his hus.
He ȝaf alle þe kniȝtes ore
Þe wind him bleu wel wide.wel above line MS.
Her endeþ þe tale of horn,
Þat fair was & · noȝt · vnorn;was] s above line MS. noȝt above line MS.
Make we vs glade Eure among,
For þus him endeþ hornes song.
Jesus þat is of heuene king
Ȝeue vs alle his suete blessing! Amen.
Y wil ȝou telle of kinges tvo,
Hende haþeols was on of þo,
Fram Humber norþ þan walt he,
Þat was in to þe wan see,
He no hadde no child, as ȝe may here,
Bot a sone þat was him dere;
Þe king was glad & of gode chere,
He sent after frendes fer & nere
To horn his sone he hem bitauȝt,he hem] omit MS.: supplied by Caro.
Wiþ him to play & lere to ride,
Fiue ȝer in þat ich tide,
Þe childer name as it is told,
To serue wiþ al his miȝt;
Seþen Horn fond hem ful fikel,
In herd is nouȝt to hide,
On hunting was him most couþe,
For to blowe an horn wiþ mouþe
To harpe wele & play at ches,
Out of danmark com an here,
Alle her pray to schip þai bere
Schepe & nete to schip þai brouȝt
In herd is nouȝt to hide.
Wiþ helme on heued & brini briȝt
Alle were þai redi to fiȝt
& rered gonfeynoun.gonfeynoun over an erasure MS.
On alerton more al þai mett,
In a morning þai bi gan,morning] mornig MS.
Of al þat day þai no blan
Þat er wer white so feþer on swan,
Þe danis men were al slan:
Who so goþ or rideþ þer bi,
Ȝete may men see þer bones ly
Hende haþeolf, as y ȝou say,
Þe folk of him was fain.
Þai toke anon þat ich pray,
Schepe & nete þat þer slain lay,
And ȝaf it þe folk oȝain;
He ȝaf to squier & to kniȝt,
Schipes he dede to lond drawe
& ȝaf to bond men on rawe,
Þo he seye þat were wiȝt,
Wiþ helme on heued & brini briȝt
& þo þat were douhti in fiȝt,
Sexti dubbed he þer to kniȝt,
And sum he ȝas londes brade,
To sing for þe dedes sake:
For to hunten on blakeowe more
To telle þe dere strong it wore,
He held a fest at pikering,
& seþþen to ȝork, was nouȝt to layn,
King haþeolf tok þe children auȝt,
Þat he had his sone bitauȝt,
& gan to wepe anon:after weþe, sore MS.
'Ich aue won mi fon wiþ mauȝt,
Þat we oȝein in batayl fauȝt,
Þat of þinkeþ me ful fare
Þe lond þat þai held of me,
Alle y ȝiue ȝou here fre,
Wiþ Horn, mi sone, y wil ȝe be,
As ȝour faders han ben wiþ me,
Þat ȝe schal neuer fram him fle,
For gold no siluer, lond no fe,
To horn his sone he hem bi toke
& dede hem swere opon þe boke,
Wiþ helme on heued & brini briȝt,
Hende haþeolf þat was so fre,
No lenge no hadde he pes.
Out of yrlond com kinges þre,
Her names can y telle þe,
Malkan king was on of þo,
Al westmer land stroyed þay.westmer] me over an erasure MS.
Þe word com on a Whissonday
To king haþeolf at his des.
He bad þe harpour leuen his lay:
He sent his sond niȝt & day
'Bid hem, þat þai com to me,
Al þat hold her lond fre,
Þan long to liue in sorwe & pain,
To com to þe kinges cri
& seþþen to staynes more þai rode,
Þe rout was boþe long & brod,
To fel þo fay in fiȝt;
Til amorwe þat it was day,
Þe irise ost was long & brade,
On staines more þer þai rade,
Þai ȝaf a crie for prede;
Sexti þousand were layd to grounde
In herd is nouȝt to hide;
King haþeolf slouȝ wiþ his hond,
Þat was comen out of yrlond,
For þe irise ost was mani & mo
Ful long seþþen man seyd so:
When men schuld to batayl go,
His stede þat schuld him bere:
Now schal men finde kinges fewe,
Þat in batail be so trewe,
When king haþeolf on fot stode,
Þe yrise folk about him ȝode,
Whom he hit opon þe hode,
Were he neuer kniȝt so gode,
He ȝaue a dint wel sare;
Þe Irise ost tok hem to red,
To ston þat douhti kniȝt to ded,
Þai durst neiȝe him na mare.neiȝe] i above line MS.
Gret diol it was to se
Of hende haþeolf þat was so fre,
Þai brak him boþe legge & kne,
Gret diol it was to se,
King malcan wiþ wretþe out stert
& smot king haþeolf to þe hert;
He held his wepen so fast,
Þat king malkan smot his arm atvo,
Er he miȝt gete his swerd him fro,
Þo king malkan wan þe priis,
Oway brouȝt he no mo ywis,
Þat wounded were in bak & side;
& left her fair folk al slain
Þarf hem noiþer niȝt no day
Make her ros þai wan þe pray,Make] m corrected out of þ MS.
Bot slowe þe king, y wene.
Alle he sesed in his hand,
Al þat he to forn him fand,
As fast as þai may,After þai, I erased MS.
He toke him Horn bi þe hand;
When he hadde teld his tiþeand,
Of mi self is me nouȝt,
Bot horn, his sone, ichaue þe brouȝt,
Ressaiued hem niȝen, Herlaund þe tende,þe] e above line MS.
'Mete and drink y schal hem fende,
Horn schal be me leue & dere.'
He bad harlaund schuld him lere,
Þuf, in boke as we rede,
Alle þai were in court to fede,
Alle were þai cloþed in o wede,
To ride on palfray oþer on stede,
Horn was boþe war & wise,hor MS.
At hunting oft he wan þe priis,
Of al gle he hadde in siȝt
Þe word of Horn wide sprong,
Hou he was boþe michel & long,
Þer was no kniȝt in jnglond,
Þat miȝt adint stond of his hond,
As white as milke he was naked,
Meke he was & trewe so stiel,
Hadde no child bi þe quene,
Al þai seyd þat hir sene,
Sche was a feir may & a schene,
Bot tristrem or ysoud it ware,
Þat miri maiden wald nouȝt wond,
Forþi sche sent hir sond,After sent, wiþ MS.
For Horn schuld cum wiþ him.
Ȝif he horn wiþ him brouȝt,
For þi he lete horn at hame,
To maiden Rimneld inne.inne] omit MS. in supplied by Ritson, inne Michel.
Þe miri maiden, al so sone
As haþerof jn to chaumber come,
Sche wend, þat it wer horn.
Þat seuien miȝt sit þer on,
A baudekin þer on was spred;
Þider þe maiden hadde hem led,
Þan a seriaunt sche bad go,
A gentil goshauk for to ta,
And ȝaf Haþerof of her ȝift.ȝif MS.
¶ Sche wende bi Haþerof, Horn it were,
On him hir loue was liȝt:
A les of grehoundes forþ þai brouȝt,
Þou schalt haue þis houndes þre,
Þat wele can take a dere;
& haþerof, for þe loue of me,
Com to morn, & horn wiþ þe';
He lay hir hert ful nere.
Þe maiden bour was fair spred,
In what maner þat sche mouȝt
Þe maiden was briȝt and schene
Anon hir selue hadde hem ledde
To sitten opon her owhen bedde,
Sche lete fet forþ a stede blac,
Þe stiropes were of silke wite,
It was me told þou schult be kniȝt;
Y þe ȝif here a stede liȝt,
An horn y schal ȝiue þe ane,
Sett wiþ mani a riche ston,
¶ Þe baudrike was of silk riȝt,
Þe maiden self it hadde ydiȝt,
Horn, at þi wille schal it be,
In herd is nouȝt to hide.'
Of al swerdes it is king,
Horn, to þe ich it þouȝt;
Is nouȝt a kniȝt in Inglond,
Schal sitten adint of þine hond,
Þe maiden of hir ȝift fre,
Rimnild, for þe loue of þe
Y schal iuste, þat þou schalt se,
So neiȝe hir hert it ȝede;
& sche wel trewely haþ him hiȝt,
Ȝif þat he be dubbed kniȝt,
Horn was dubbed to kniȝt,Horn] orn over erasure MS.
Has houlak king hadde hem hiȝt;
A turnament þe king lete crie,
Maiden rimneld biheld þat play,þat] þ MS.
Hou Horn wan þe priis þat day,
To wite & nouȝt to wene.The guard has to wite & nouȝt.
In his bour forto cheseAfter forto, e erased MS.
Þat he schuld take non oþer rede:
For sche wel trewely haþ him hiȝt,
Wiþ þe king of Fraunce duelled he,
Mani time þai gat þe gre,
¶ Þe king seiȝe, þat þai wer wiȝt,
Boþe he dubbed hem to kniȝt
Þus þai duelled þer in pes,
To hem, þat þai miȝt þe better be,þai above line MS.
Þat he schal dubbed be to kniȝtAfter be erasure of two letters MS.
Wigard & wikel hem biþouȝt,wikel] l over erasure MS.
Hou Horn bi þi douhter lay:
Þe king leued þat þai sede;
'For þi ȝaf sche him þe stede,
He went hom as he were wode,
In to boure anon he ȝode
¶ He bete hir so, þat sche gan blede,
Þe maidens fleiȝe oway for drede,
Giltles sche was of þat dede,Giltles] gitles MS.
Y wende wele haue suffred nane
Þe king in to his chaumber is gon
& schet him self þer in al on,
Þei þat horn was sore adrad,
In to boure he was ladde,
He fond hir liggeand on hir bedde,
'Bi god of heuen þat me bouȝt,
Of mi selue is me nouȝt,
& to mi fader ous bi wraid,
Bot, horn, ȝif it so schal bitide,
Þat þou schalt out of lond ride
Þis seuen winter y schal abide,
Of no loue ne schal he spede,
Þat y ne schal kepe mi maidenhede,
So help me god, to þe!
Horn, to morwe in þe morningmorning] moring MS.
ȝif god þe spede an hunting,
Loke þou bring it bifor þe king,
As he sittes at his des,
& he schal telle þe al his þouȝt,
Er þou fram þat bord go.'
A morwen Horn to hunting is gan,
To take þe wilde wiþ þe tam,
Þe king seyd, 'it is for nouȝt:
To morwe ȝif y þe finde,
Bi mi croun, þou schalt be slawe,
Wiþ wilde hors al to drawe
To rimneld he com, wiþ outen lesing,
'Loke þou forsake it for no þing,
Þe ston it is wel trewe:
Þan chaungeþ þe þouȝt of þi leman,
Þan haue y lorn mi maidenhed,
Horn seyd, 'in þine erber is atre,
Ygrowen al wiþ yue:yue] y corrected out of n MS.
Rimnild, for þe loue of me,
& when þou sest mi schadu þare,
Þan am y bon to wiue;
& while þou sest mi schadu nouȝt,
Þere he sat opon his seghe
Wiþ him he toke his gode stede
Haþerof durst nouȝt wiþ him fare,
So wroþ þe king was he.After wroþ, þe erased MS.
Maidens in þe boure gan crie
When horn com fer out of þat siȝt,
Al so fast as he miȝt,
Horn no miȝt he neuer gete,
Wiard rode souþe & horn rode west,
Wel long er þai so mete.
¶ Þurch aforest as he schuld fare,
An armed kniȝt mett he þare,
To ȝeld his harneise lesse & mare
Oþer iuste, wheþer him leuer ware,
Þe lawe is nouȝt to hide.
& horn of iusting was ful fain,
¶ Þe kniȝt toke a schaft in hand,
¶ Horn tok on al so long
A ful touȝ & to so strong
Þe kniȝtes scheld he cleue atvo
& of his plates he brac þo
Out of his sadel he bar him þan,
He brac his arm & his schulderban,
When he of his swoning bicam,his] omit MS.
Man y made of flesche no ban,
In seruise wiþ ȝour king to be,
Þat lord is of þis land.'
In al Wales is þer nan
Ȝif þou þe seuen days mai hold,
Com rideand on a stede broun
Wiþ a soket o stel feloun,ofeloun MS. stel omit MS. (see Alisaunder, 4415).
Þe king at snowedoun he fond þare,
He iusted al þat seuen niȝt,
In herd is nouȝt to hide.
He smot þe king opon þe scheld,
Of his hors he made him held
Swiche on hadde he founde feld,
Þat so had feld him in þe seld,
Þe king asked him, what he hiȝt,
Ȝif þat þou wil duelle wiþ me,
& toke þe king aletter in hand,
Fro aking þat men dede wrong,
His owhen sone, ich vnder stond,
He schuld han help, is nouȝt to layn,
Horn to batayl was ful boun
& folwed þe messangers out of toun,
In to Irlond þai him lede.
Hem com anhauen wele to hand,
Þat ȝolkil is cleped in irland,
Þe letter told þat he brouȝt,
King Finlak dede to malkan say,
Wheþer he wold bi niȝt or day,
To hayles Horn, when þai him sawe,hayles] corrected out of haylett MS.
Anon þai gun to striue raþe,
Wheþer of hem him schuld haue,
Horn answerd hem þan as hende
Þe king þan wald y se,
Where me leuest is to duelle,
Hou he hadde ywon þe stede,
'Sir, miȝtestow hold him to þi nede,
King malkan þarf þe nouȝt drede,
Hour king haþ boden him gold & fe,
Wiþ þat he wil wiþ him be
& Horn ful trewely haþ him hiȝt
For to stond in stede of kniȝt,
In herd is nouȝt to hide.'
Þat alle þai be to malkan gan,
Bot finlak king him al an
Ȝif crist wil þat it be.
King malkan dede bede out here,
Opon þe king finlak to were;
Ȝif he wil fiȝt, he schal be slan,
Ȝif he wil bide, he schal be tan:
Y trowe best he wil fle.'
Bot þre woukes were þer sett,
Þat alle þis folk schal be mett,
Þe Walis king hadde gret lett
He no miȝt in to irlond come,
King finlak seyd, 'is nouȝt to hide,
Þis batayl dar y nouȝt abide;
Mi rede is tan to fle.'
& þan was Horn as fain o fiȝt,
As is þe foule of þe liȝt,
Y rede þou bede riche ȝift:bede] de above the line MS.
Þe folk wil to þe drawe;
Geder to þe folk þat þou may,
To fle me þink it is gret schame,
Ar dintes be smiten or ani man slan,
Þe kinges sones wer kniȝtes bold,
& seyd þai wald þe batail hold,
Finlac king, þei he war ald,
Bleþeli he seyd fiȝt he wald,
Þus þai riden out of toun
¶ Þer Horn seiȝe þe mest þrang,
It was no man of yrland,
Miȝt stond adint of his hand,
At ich stroke he slouȝ onOne leaf of MS. lost here.
Maiden & wiif gret sorwe gan make
Þe blod ran ouer his eiȝe.
& bad sche schuld a plaster ta;
Þe kinges douhter, in þat stounde;
Of him hye is ful fain:
& now for soþe ich haue him slan,
Mi fader swerd y wan to day,
Y kepe it while y liue may.
Þai birid þe folk þat were slan,
& sesed it in to Hornnes hond,
Þat no com to his somoun.After þat, it MS.
Wheþer sche seiȝe him ride or go,
Hir þouȝt hir hert brak atvo,
Þat sche no spac wiþ þat bliþe.
On aday sche made hir seke,
To him spac þat maiden fre
Ouer al horn þe priis him wan,
He seyd it was for owiman,
Þat horn hir loued & most gode an
Of anoþer was al his þouȝt,
Sche lay his hert ful nere.
Þe ring to schewen haþ he tan,
Þe hewe was chaunged of þe stan,
He busked him for to ride
& gedred folk eueraware,eueraware] Michel prints eueriwhare.
An hundred kniȝtes bi his side,
Þai sayled ouer þe flode so gray,
Vnder awode þer þai gan lende,
Horn fast after him gan ride
Þe begger answerd in þat tide,
Y wold haue teld þe wennes y cam
Horn to seke haue y gon
& me no was no noþer ȝeuen
Y go to seke aster him ay,
To day is moging þe king
Mani sides schuld be bi bled,
Er he bring hir to his bed,
Gentil man, ȝif þou be fre,
¶ Þi knaue wald y fain be,
'Ich hat Horn, is nouȝt to lain,
Bot ȝif ich held þat þou hast seyd,
Er þat þai ben in bed layd,
Haue here mi robe to mede;
Bring hem vnder ȝon wode side,
Al so ȝern astow may ride,
Þe way þou canst hem lede;
& y schal heiȝe me wel sone,
Y com oȝain, er it be none,
When horn fro fer herd glewe,
Muging king ful wele he knewe,Muging] first g corrected out of n MS.
He tok him bi þe lorein newe,
Horn ful trewely haþ him hiȝt,
He schal him ȝeld þat ich niȝt,
A box schal ben his mede.
Þat he hadde smiten þe pouer man so,þe] e above line MS.
Wiþ þi þou lat mi bridel be,
What so þou wilt aski me,
Þe king was wroþ & rewe his ȝift:
Horn seyd, 'Y sett a nett otime:horn] n above line MS.
ȝif ani fische is taken þer inne
No schal it neuer more be mine,
Y wold it were sonken in helle pine,
Y schal it loue in hertþouȝt,
Vnto þe castel wiþ gle & game;
A fole þai wende he were.
To day in þine halle be,
When folk is gon to sete;
Þan y wil folwe þe ham,
& þat y mot wiþ þe gan
To haue þere þi mete.'þi] his MS., correction by Ritson.
Horn wald nouȝt be þe last
Þe porter cald him herlot swain,in one line MS.
& he put him oȝain,in one line MS.
His scholder bon he brak ato,
& in anon he þrange.þrange] r above line MS.
Þe bord was sett, þe cloþ was layd;
Þe trompes blewe, þe glewemen pleyd,blewe] yede MS., correction by Ritson.
Þe bischopes had þe grace y seyd,
Michel he þouȝt & more he speke,
For fole men schuld him hold.
Þan was þe lawe, soþe to say,
Þe bride schuld þe first day
To godes men schultow se,schultow] might be read schustow MS.
Þou no ouȝtest hem nouȝt forȝete;one letter erased before ouȝtest MS.
For to loke who so may
Forþ sche went, þat maiden fre,
& feched drink, þat men miȝt se,
Go nouȝt, ar þis drunken be,
ȝif euer he was þe dere.'
Þe maiden bi him stille stode,
To here of horn hir þouȝt it gode,
He lay hir hert ful nere;
Of þe coppe he drank þe wine,
Þe ring of gold he kest þer inne:
Þou schalt haue a drink mare,
Sche asked ȝif horn þer in ware;
Nas sche bot alitel fram him gon,
Þat sche ne fel adoun anon,
When sche lay opon hir bedde,
Sche seyd, 'clepe haþeros to me.'Sche] Scle MS.
& bid þe kinges make hem bliþe,
Haþerof, go in to þe erber swiþe
Horn is in þis halle to day;
Y wende he hadde ben slain:
For to haue mi maiden hede,
In seli pouer wede is he,
Y pray þe knowe him riȝt:
Say him, treuþe pliȝt er we,'
'Bid him,' sche seyd, 'as he is fre,
When al þis folk is gon to play,
For to bihald þat frely fode,
Ful wele he knewe his viis;
Opon his fot hard he stode,
Forþ þai ȝede, þo kniȝtes bold;
Of trewe loue Horn was wiis:
'Y schal com in to þe feld wiþ pride,
An hundred kniȝtes bi mi side,
Whar bi y schal Wikard knawe,
Wiþ foules blac as ani crawe,
Wiþ silke werk it is wrouȝt.
Moioun queintise is ȝalu & wan,is] was MS., correction by Ritson.
Þat he wiþ him haþ brouȝt;
Floure de liis sett bi tvene,
& after wisarmes he gan frain;wisarmes] was armes MS., correction by Ritson.
Was neuer Rimnild ere so fain
& bid mi fader make him bliþe
Wikard, þat is leue to smite,
Horn schal him his dettes quite,
To niȝt it schal be bouȝt.'
When þai hadde eten, þan were þai boun;
Wiþ trump & tabourun out of toun
Þus þai redde þe riȝt roun,
& horn com in to þe feld wiþ pride,
An hundred kniȝtes bi his side,
In rime as it is told.
Horn of her coming was wel wise,her] omit MS., supplied by Caro.
Moioun king haþ tint þe priis,
Vnder his hors fete he liis,
To sir wigard his swerd he weued,
Euen ato he cleue his heued,
His box he ȝalt him þo;
Traitours þat er leue to liȝe,er supplied in margin MS.
Þat day Horn þe turnament wan
He toke þe gre þat was a swan,
¶ To houlac king horn gan wende
'Þou feddest me & forsterd to man.'ou fed over an erasure MS.
He maked wikel telle out þanmaked] d added in darker ink MS.
Tint he haþ þat swete wiȝt
Horn þat hadde hir treuþe pliȝt,
Horn brouȝt hir to his bedde;
Wiþ mi douȝter, while y liue,
Forþ, as we telle in gest,
Into norþ humber land for to fare,
To winne þat his sader ware,
To winne his fader lond oȝain,
into norþ humber land to fare
To winne al þat his fader ware,
Þan horn to lond y comen is,lond] d above line MS. The rest is wanting.
